citeinfo.origin: Frank Winters, NYS GIS Program Office, State Geographic Information Officer (GIO)
citeinfo.title: Street Segment SHP - National Geospatial Data Asset (NGDA)
citeinfo.othercit: 10B Airline Drive Albany, NY 12235 UNITED STATES (518) 242-5029 Frank.Winters@its.ny.gov

descript.abstract: A vector line file of public/private streets compiled from orthoimagery and other sources that is attributed with street names, addresses, route numbers, routing attributes, and includes a related table of alternate/alias street names. If the purpose of using NYS Streets is for geocoding, the New York State Office of Information Technology Services (NYS ITS) has a publicly available geocoding service which includes the NYS Streets along with other layers. For more information about the geocoding service, please visit http://gis.ny.gov/gisdata/inventories/details.cfm?DSID=1278.
descript.purpose: A vector street layer suitable for use in a GIS.

cntinfo.cntinst: 10B Airline Drive, Albany, NY 12235 UNITED STATES

enttyp.enttypd: In ArcGIS, a collection of geographic features with the same geometry type (such as point, line, or polygon), the same attributes, and the same spatial reference.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Date the record was last modified.
Unique ID of NYS Streets.
The address on the left side of the NYS Streets linestring corresponding to the FROM node of the linestring.
The address on the left side of the NYS Streets linestring corresponding to the TO node of the linestring.
The address on the right side of the NYS Streets linestring corresponding to the FROM node of the linestring.
The address number on the right side of the NYS Streets linestring corresponding to the TO node of the linestring.
Concatenation of PreModifier, CLDXF_PreDirectional, PreType, SeparatorElement, StreetName, CLDXF_PostType, CLDXF_PostDirectional, and PostModifier, fields.
A word or phrase that precedes and modifies the Street Name element, typically separated from it by a PreType, PreDirectional, or both.
A street direction that precedes the street name.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: A word or phrase that precedes the Street Name element and identifies a type of thoroughfare.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: A preposition or prepositional phrase that separates the PreType and StreetName elements.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: The legal, authoritative name of the street.
An abbreviated street type that follows the StreetName element.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: A street direction that follows the street name.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: A descriptor that follows the street name and is not a suffix or a direction.

Indicates the type of route shield where “I” = Interstate, “IC” = Interstate Connector, “U” = US Highway, “UB” = US Highway Business Route, “UC” = US Highway Connector, “S” = State Touring Route, “SH” = State 900 Route, “SC” = State Highway Connector, “P” = Parkway, “C” = County Road, “CT” = County Touring Route.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: A route number, that is assigned to a stretch of public road.
General travel direction along a divided highway.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Code representing the ownership of a street segment. Missing codes (04, 05, 07, 08, 11) are codes that have been retired.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Feature classification code used to identify the most noticeable characteristics of a road including whether the road has limited access or is divided, gated, seasonal, a ramp, a traffic circle, a service road, a cul-de-sac, a trail/off road, a walkway, an alley, a parking area, or a planned road.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Arterial Classification Codes (ACCs) that categorize roads according to the level of travel mobility that they provide in the road network. Mobility refers to the volume of traffic that a stretch of road carries and the length of trip that it serves.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Average travel speed in miles per hour on the street.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: The direction of traffic movement along a road in relation to the FROM node and TO node of the line segment representing the road in the GIS data where “TF” is one-way in the To-From direction, “FT” is one-way in the From-To direction, and <null> indicates that travel is permitted in both directions.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: The elevation at the start of the segment where positive numbers go above grade and negative numbers go below grade. Zero is ground level.
The elevation at the end of the segment where positive numbers go above grade and negative numbers go below grade. Zero is ground level.
The general direction of travel along a divided road based on the digitizing of the linestring. FromTo indicates the direction goes with the direction the line was drawn.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: The general direction of travel along a divided road based on the digitizing of the linestring. ToFrom indicates the direction goes against the direction the line was drawn.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Represents From-To impedance in minutes where cost is calculated by dividing the distance by the speed. Distance is stored in the Shape_Leng field in meters and average travel speed is stored in the Speed field in miles per hour. Therefore travel time (Cost) is calculated as: [Shape_leng] / [Speed]. The following formula is used to calculate the time cost in meters per minute which is how the data is stored in these fields: FromToCost or ToFromCost = [Shape_leng] * 60/ [Speed] *1609

Represents From-To impedance in minutes where cost is calculated by dividing the distance by the speed. Distance is stored in the Shape_Leng field in meters and average travel speed is stored in the Speed field in miles per hour. Therefore travel time (Cost) is calculated as: [Shape_leng] / [Speed]. The following formula is used to calculate the time cost in meters per minute which is how the data is stored in these fields: FromToCost or ToFromCost = [Shape_leng] * 60/ [Speed] *1609
Abbreviation of the State name on the left side of the NYS Streets linesting.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Abbreviation of the State name on the right side of the NYS Streets linesting.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Name of the County on the left side of the NYS Street linestring.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Name of the County on the right side of the NYS Street linestring.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Postal code on the left side of the NYS streets linestring.
Postal code on the right side of the NYS streets linestring.
Name of the Zip code area on the left side of the NYS Street linestring.
Name of the Zip code area on the right side of the NYS Street linestring.
Name of the City or Town on the left side of the NYS Street linestring.
Name of the City or Town on the right side of the NYS Street linestring.
Village name, Census Designated Place (CDP), Indian Territory, or alternative allowable Zip Code name on the left side of the NYS Streets linestring.
Village name, Census Designated Place (CDP), Indian Territory, or alternative allowable Zip Code name on the right side of the NYS Streets linestring.
US Geographical Survey's Geographic Names unique identifier on the left side of the NYS Streets linestring.
US Geographical Survey's Geographic Names unique identifier on the right side of the NYS Streets linestring.
Census Block identifier on the left side of the NYS Streets linestring.
Census Block identifier on the right side of the NYS Streets linestring.
T/F (True/False) value indicates if the geometry was verified against orthoimagery or other high resolution data source.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: The primary geometry data source used to align the linestring.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: The primary data source used to populate the street name attributes on the linestring.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: The primary data source used to populate the address attributes on the linestring.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Status of the record, either Active or Retired.

edom.edomvd: See Field Description in Streets Data Dictionary

attr.attrdef: Fully spelled out direction that precedes the StreetName element.
Fully spelled out street type that follows the StreetName element.
Fully spelled out direction that follows the StreetName element.
Same as CompleteStreetName but with PreDirectional, PostType, and PostDirectional abbreviated.
NY.gov ID of the user creating the linestring (GeoLynx edit tracking field).
Date and Time the linestring was created (GeoLynx edit tracking field).
NY.gov ID of the user modifying an attribute on the linestring (GeoLynx edit tracking field).
Date and Time an attribute on the linestring was modified (GeoLynx edit tracking field).

Date and Time the linestring was spatially modified (GeoLynx edit tracking field).
NY.gov ID of the user modifying the linestring (ESRI edit tracking field).
Country on the left side of the NYS streets linestring.
Country on the right side of the NYS streets linestring.
Odd, Even, or Both addressing on the left side of the NYS streets linestring. Currently blank - Reserved for future use.
Odd, Even, or Both addressing on the right side of the NYS streets linestring. Currently blank - Reserved for future use.
Emergency Service Zone number on the left side of the NYS streets linestring.
Emergency Service Zone number on the right side of the NYS streets linestring.
Length of feature in internal units.

enttyp.enttypd: Alternate street names related through the NYSStreetID attribute

overview.eaover: The Streets Data Dictionary document contains attribute field names and descriptions for the data used in the file.
overview.eadetcit: The Streets Data Dictionary documents is available for download on the NYS GIS Clearinghouse at: http://gis.ny.gov/gisdata/supportfiles/Streets-Data-Dictionary.pdf

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

procstep.procdesc: From 2001 through 2005, the NYS GIS Program Office (GPO), then part of the NYS Office for Technology (OFT), partnered with the NYS Department of Transportation (DOT) and the NYS Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV), to create a statewide GIS street centerline file for use as the GIS streets database in DMV’s modernized Accident Location Information System (ALIS). The statewide GIS street centerline file was built from the best available local and state sources and was supplemented with contractor sources. The data was subsequently maintained through contracts with Tele Atlas® (now TomTom) until March 2008 and then with NAVTEQ® (now HERE North America LLC) from January 2009 through December 2013. During this maintenance time, the GPO, DOT, and several counties provided updates through the use of an online change notification system. In 2014, the GPO took over all maintenance of the data. Counties and the DOT continually provide updates through the GPO’s online data editing application or directly to the GPO through other communication methods. The GPO continually evaluates edits made to the NYS Address Points data and applies relevant changes to the NYS Streets data to keep the two GIS files in sync.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: A vector line file of public/private streets compiled from orthoimagery and other sources that is attributed with street names, addresses, route numbers, routing attributes, and includes a related table of alternate/alias street names. If the purpose of using NYS Streets is for geocoding, the New York State Office of Information Technology Services (NYS ITS) has a publicly available geocoding service which includes the NYS Streets along with other layers. For more information about the geocoding service, please visit http://gis.ny.gov/gisdata/inventories/details.cfm?DSID=1278.
